metadata.Title: CVE-2022-20158 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description: In bdi_put and bdi_unregister of backing-dev.c, there is a possible memory corruption due to a use after free. This could lead to local escalation of privilege with System execution privileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID: A-182815710References: Upstream kernel

notes.Note: sbeattie> It seems the android advisory that contains this CVE has been updated to correctly reflect the associated commits with this issue; furthermore, it appears to have been introduced with an android only commit (see lore reference).

criterions.comment: linux-aws-5.11: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-aws-5.13').
